newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-RFU GIVE ULTIMATUM TO ENGLAND RUGBY CLUBS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-RFU GIVE ULTIMATUM TO ENGLAND RUGBY CLUBS.

text.p: Leading England rugby union clubs have been given until noon on Tuesday to guarantee all players selected for the Five Nations' championship will be unconditionally released.

The English Professional Rugby Union Clubs (EPRUC) refused to release players for divisional matches against touring teams late last year but said all players would be available for the Five Nations' tournament.
On Monday EPRUC chief executive Kim Deshayes said he had been presented with an ultimatum by the Rugby Football Union.
"We have been given until noon tomorrow to guarantee that all players selected for England will be given free release without any conditions attached," Deshayes said.
"It is desperately disappointing because we had amicable meetings with the RFU leading officials and talked harmoniously about the clubs' requirements.
"Then we receive this ultimatum and an agreement for us to sign which is fundamentally different from what we believed would be the final document."
England, who have the bye in Saturday's first round, open their campaign at Twickenham against Scotland on February 1.
